page.title: 06ANCILLARY UNITS (a)
page.content: During the Second World War R.A.F. personnel suffering from pulmonary disorders were flown from all over the world to King Edward VII Hospital for treatment. Since the war, the R.A.F. has maintained a{"Chest Unit"}at the hospital, though this has now been reduced to seven beds on Portal Ward. Patients are still sent by the R.A.F. from different parts of the world, many of them being young airmen suffering from asthma. An R.A.F. Wing Commander is in charge of the unit and he is also involved in research at the hospital. An R.A.F. Sergeant is also resident, and he deals with all the paperwork.
